001package io.cyborgcode.roa.ui.selenium.shadowroot;
002
003import io.cyborgcode.roa.ui.selenium.exceptions.UiInteractionException;
004import io.cyborgcode.roa.ui.selenium.smart.SmartWebDriver;
005import io.cyborgcode.roa.ui.selenium.smart.SmartWebElement;
006import java.util.Map;
007import org.openqa.selenium.By;
008import org.openqa.selenium.JavascriptExecutor;
009import org.openqa.selenium.WebDriver;
010import org.openqa.selenium.WebElement;
011
012import static io.cyborgcode.roa.ui.config.UiConfigHolder.getUiConfig;
013
014/**
015 * Utility class for interacting with Shadow DOM elements using Selenium.
016 * Provides methods to locate elements within Shadow Roots, including
017 * support for waiting and polling mechanisms.
018 *
019 * @author Cyborg Code Syndicate üíçüë®üíª
020 */
021public class ShadowDomUtils {
022
023   /**
024    * Default polling interval in milliseconds if not explicitly specified.
025    */
026   private static final long DEFAULT_POLL_INTERVAL_MS = 500;
027   private static final String VALUE = "value";
028   private static final String MAX_WAIT = "maxWait";
029   private static final String POLL_INTERVAL = "pollInterval";
030
031   private ShadowDomUtils() {
032   }
033
034   /**
035    * Converts a Selenium {@code By} locator into a map representation.
036    * This is used by JavaScript scripts for element searching.
037    *
038    * @param by Selenium {@code By} locator.
039    * @return A map containing the locator type and value.
040    * @throws IllegalArgumentException if an unsupported locator type is used.
041    */
042   private static Map<String, Object> parseBy(By by) {
043      String asString = by.toString(); // e.g. "By.id: username"
044
045      if (asString.startsWith("By.id: ")) {
046         return Map.of("type", "id",
047               VALUE, asString.substring("By.id: ".length()).trim());
048      } else if (asString.startsWith("By.name: ")) {
049         return Map.of("type", "name",
050               VALUE, asString.substring("By.name: ".length()).trim());
051      } else if (asString.startsWith("By.className: ")) {
052         return Map.of("type", "className",
053               VALUE, asString.substring("By.className: ".length()).trim());
054      } else if (asString.startsWith("By.cssSelector: ")) {
055         return Map.of("type", "css",
056               VALUE, asString.substring("By.cssSelector: ".length()).trim());
057      } else if (asString.startsWith("By.tagName: ")) {
058         return Map.of("type", "tagName",
059               VALUE, asString.substring("By.tagName: ".length()).trim());
060      } else if (asString.startsWith("By.linkText: ")) {
061         return Map.of("type", "linkText",
062               VALUE, asString.substring("By.linkText: ".length()).trim());
063      } else if (asString.startsWith("By.partialLinkText: ")) {
064         return Map.of("type", "partialLinkText",
065               VALUE, asString.substring("By.partialLinkText: ".length()).trim());
066      } else if (asString.startsWith("By.xpath: ")) {
067         throw new IllegalArgumentException(
068               "Xpath selectors are not supported inside shadow roots. Please change your xpath selector: "
069                     + asString + "to any other selenium supported selector");
070      } else {
071         throw new IllegalArgumentException("Unsupported By type: " + asString);
072      }
073   }
074
075   // -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
076   // 1) SCRIPTS FOR FINDING A SINGLE ELEMENT (with optional in-JS waiting)
077   // -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
078
079   /**
080    * JavaScript function to locate a single shadow DOM element.
081    * The script searches for elements inside shadow roots and supports
082    * different locator strategies such as id, name, class, CSS, tag name,
083    * link text, and partial link text. XPath is not supported within shadow DOMs.
084    */
085   private static final String FIND_SHADOW_ELEMENT_JS = """
086         function findShadowElement(params) {
087           const type = params.type;
088           const value = params.value;
089           const maxWait = params.maxWait || 10000;
090           const pollInterval = params.pollInterval || 500;
091         
092           function findInRoot(root, type, value) {
093             switch (type) {
094               case 'id':
095                 return root.querySelector('#' + value);
096               case 'name':
097                 return root.querySelector('[name="' + value + '"]');
098               case 'className':
099                 var classes = value.trim().split(/\\s+/).join('.');
100                 return root.querySelector('.' + classes);
101               case 'css':
102                 return root.querySelector(value);
103               case 'tagName':
104                 return root.querySelector(value);
105               case 'xpath':
106                 return document.evaluate(
107                   value,
108                   root,
109                   null,
110                   XPathResult.FIRST_ORDERED_NODE_TYPE,
111                   null
112                 ).singleNodeValue;
113               case 'linkText':
114                 var anchors = root.querySelectorAll('a');
115                 for (var i = 0; i < anchors.length; i++) {
116                   if (anchors[i].textContent === value) {
117                     return anchors[i];
118                   }
119                 }
120                 return null;
121               case 'partialLinkText':
122                 var anchors2 = root.querySelectorAll('a');
123                 for (var j = 0; j < anchors2.length; j++) {
124                   if (anchors2[j].textContent.includes(value)) {
125                     return anchors2[j];
126                   }
127                 }
128                 return null;
129               default:
130                 return null;
131             }
132           }
133         
134           function searchShadow(rootNodes, type, value) {
135             for (var i = 0; i < rootNodes.length; i++) {
136               var node = rootNodes[i];
137               if (node && node.shadowRoot) {
138                 var found = findInRoot(node.shadowRoot, type, value);
139                 if (found) {
140                   return found;
141                 }
142                 // Recurse deeper
143                 var deeper = searchShadow(node.shadowRoot.querySelectorAll('*'), type, value);
144                 if (deeper) {
145                   return deeper;
146                 }
147               }
148             }
149             return null;
150           }
151         
152           const startTime = performance.now();
153           while ((performance.now() - startTime) < maxWait) {
154             // 1) Try main document
155             var direct = findInRoot(document, type, value);
156             if (direct) {
157               return direct;
158             }
159             // 2) Search shadow
160             var all = document.querySelectorAll('*');
161             var shadowFound = searchShadow(all, type, value);
162             if (shadowFound) {
163               return shadowFound;
164             }
165             // 3) Wait/poll
166             var now = performance.now();
167             while (performance.now() - now < pollInterval) {
168               // busy wait - will block the page
169             }
170           }
171           return null; // not found
172         }
173         return findShadowElement(arguments[0]);
174         """;
175
176
177   /**
178    * Finds the first matching element across the entire document, including nested shadow roots.
179    * Waits up to the default timeout duration, polling at defined intervals.
180    *
181    * @param driver The {@link SmartWebDriver} instance.
182    * @param by     The {@link By} locator to use.
183    * @return The found {@link SmartWebElement}, or null if not found.
184    */
185   public static SmartWebElement findElementInShadowRoots(SmartWebDriver driver, By by) {
186      long wait = getUiConfig().waitDuration()
187            * 1000L;
188      return findElementInShadowRoots(driver, by, wait);
189   }
190
191   /**
192    * Finds the first matching element across the document and nested shadow roots with a specified timeout.
193    *
194    * @param driver       The {@link SmartWebDriver} instance.
195    * @param by           The {@link By} locator.
196    * @param waitInMillis Maximum wait time in milliseconds.
197    * @return The found {@link SmartWebElement}, or null if not found.
198    */
199   public static SmartWebElement findElementInShadowRoots(SmartWebDriver driver, By by, long waitInMillis) {
200      JavascriptExecutor js = (JavascriptExecutor) driver.getOriginal();
201      Map<String, Object> selector = parseBy(by);
202
203      selector = new java.util.HashMap<>(selector);
204      selector.put(MAX_WAIT, waitInMillis);
205      selector.put(POLL_INTERVAL, DEFAULT_POLL_INTERVAL_MS);
206
207      WebElement element = (WebElement) js.executeScript(FIND_SHADOW_ELEMENT_JS, selector);
208      if (element == null) {
209         throw new UiInteractionException("Finding element in shadow root via java script failed");
210      }
211
212      return new SmartWebElement(element, driver.getOriginal());
213   }
214
215   /**
216    * Finds the first matching element in nested Shadow DOMs, starting from a given root element.
217    * Waits up to the configured maximum wait time, polling every {@code DEFAULT_POLL_INTERVAL_MS}.
218    *
219    * @param root The root {@link SmartWebElement} to start the search from.
220    * @param by   The {@link By} locator to use for finding the element.
221    * @return The found {@link SmartWebElement}, or {@code null} if no element is found within the time limit.
222    */
223   public static SmartWebElement findElementInShadowRoots(SmartWebElement root, By by) {
224      if (root == null) {
225         return null;
226      }
227      WebDriver driver = root.getDriver();
228      JavascriptExecutor js = (JavascriptExecutor) driver;
229
230      Map<String, Object> selector = parseBy(by);
231      selector = new java.util.HashMap<>(selector);
232      long wait = getUiConfig().waitDuration() * 1000L;
233      selector.put(MAX_WAIT, wait);
234      selector.put(POLL_INTERVAL, DEFAULT_POLL_INTERVAL_MS);
235
236      WebElement element = (WebElement) js.executeScript(FIND_SHADOW_ELEMENT_FROM_ELEMENT_JS, root.getOriginal(),
237            selector);
238      if (element == null) {
239         throw new UiInteractionException("Finding element in shadow root via java script failed");
240      }
241
242      return new SmartWebElement(element, driver);
243   }
244
245   /**
246    * JavaScript function to locate a single shadow DOM element.
247    * The script searches for elements inside shadow roots and supports
248    * different locator strategies such as id, name, class, CSS, tag name,
249    * link text, and partial link text. XPath is not supported within shadow DOMs.
250    */
251   private static final String FIND_SHADOW_ELEMENT_FROM_ELEMENT_JS = """
252         function findShadowElementFromRoot(rootElem, params) {
253           const type = params.type;
254           const value = params.value;
255           const maxWait = params.maxWait || 10000;
256           const pollInterval = params.pollInterval || 500;
257         
258           function findInRoot(root, type, value) {
259             // same approach as above
260             switch (type) {
261               case 'id':
262                 return root.querySelector('#' + value);
263               case 'name':
264                 return root.querySelector('[name="' + value + '"]');
265               case 'className':
266                 var classes = value.trim().split(/\\s+/).join('.');
267                 return root.querySelector('.' + classes);
268               case 'css':
269                 return root.querySelector(value);
270               case 'tagName':
271                 return root.querySelector(value);
272               case 'xpath':
273                 return document.evaluate(value, root, null, XPathResult.FIRST_ORDERED_NODE_TYPE, null).singleNodeValue;
274               case 'linkText':
275                 var anchors = root.querySelectorAll('a');
276                 for (var i = 0; i < anchors.length; i++) {
277                   if (anchors[i].textContent === value) {
278                     return anchors[i];
279                   }
280                 }
281                 return null;
282               case 'partialLinkText':
283                 var anchors2 = root.querySelectorAll('a');
284                 for (var j = 0; j < anchors2.length; j++) {
285                   if (anchors2[j].textContent.includes(value)) {
286                     return anchors2[j];
287                   }
288                 }
289                 return null;
290               default:
291                 return null;
292             }
293           }
294         
295           function searchShadow(rootNodes, type, value) {
296             for (var i = 0; i < rootNodes.length; i++) {
297               var node = rootNodes[i];
298               if (node && node.shadowRoot) {
299                 var found = findInRoot(node.shadowRoot, type, value);
300                 if (found) {
301                   return found;
302                 }
303                 var deeper = searchShadow(node.shadowRoot.querySelectorAll('*'), type, value);
304                 if (deeper) {
305                   return deeper;
306                 }
307               }
308             }
309             return null;
310           }
311         
312           const startTime = performance.now();
313           while ((performance.now() - startTime) < maxWait) {
314             // 1) if rootElem itself has a shadowRoot
315             if (rootElem.shadowRoot) {
316               var shadowDirect = findInRoot(rootElem.shadowRoot, type, value);
317               if (shadowDirect) {
318                 return shadowDirect;
319               }
320               var shadowDeep = searchShadow(rootElem.shadowRoot.querySelectorAll('*'), type, value);
321               if (shadowDeep) {
322                 return shadowDeep;
323               }
324             }
325         
326             // 2) check rootElem itself as a normal DOM container
327             var direct = findInRoot(rootElem, type, value);
328             if (direct) {
329               return direct;
330             }
331         
332             // 3) check children shadow roots
333             var children = rootElem.querySelectorAll('*');
334             var deeper = searchShadow(children, type, value);
335             if (deeper) {
336               return deeper;
337             }
338         
339             // 4) poll
340             var now = performance.now();
341             while (performance.now() - now < pollInterval) {
342               // busy wait
343             }
344           }
345           return null;
346         }
347         return findShadowElementFromRoot(arguments[0], arguments[1]);
348         """;
349
350   // -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
351   // 2) SCRIPTS FOR FINDING MULTIPLE ELEMENTS + WAIT
352   // -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
353
354   /**
355    * JavaScript function to find all matching elements within Shadow DOMs.
356    * The script recursively searches the main document and any shadow roots
357    * for elements that match the given selector. The results are collected
358    * and returned as an array of matching elements.
359    */
360   private static final String FIND_SHADOW_ELEMENTS_JS = """
361         function findShadowElements(params) {
362           const type = params.type;
363           const value = params.value;
364           const maxWait = params.maxWait || 10000;
365           const pollInterval = params.pollInterval || 500;
366         
367           // We'll collect all matches in an array.
368           function collectInRoot(root, type, value) {
369             let nodeList = [];
370             switch (type) {
371               case 'id':
372                 let elById = root.querySelector('#' + value);
373                 if (elById) nodeList.push(elById);
374                 break;
375               case 'name':
376                 nodeList = root.querySelectorAll('[name="' + value + '"]');
377                 break;
378               case 'className':
379                 var classes = value.trim().split(/\\s+/).join('.');
380                 nodeList = root.querySelectorAll('.' + classes);
381                 break;
382               case 'css':
383                 nodeList = root.querySelectorAll(value);
384                 break;
385               case 'tagName':
386                 nodeList = root.querySelectorAll(value);
387                 break;
388               case 'xpath':
389                 let xresult = document.evaluate(value, root, null, XPathResult.ORDERED_NODE_SNAPSHOT_TYPE, null);
390                 for (let i = 0; i < xresult.snapshotLength; i++) {
391                   nodeList.push(xresult.snapshotItem(i));
392                 }
393                 break;
394               case 'linkText':
395                 let allAnchors = root.querySelectorAll('a');
396                 allAnchors.forEach(a => {
397                   if (a.textContent === value) nodeList.push(a);
398                 });
399                 break;
400               case 'partialLinkText':
401                 let anchors2 = root.querySelectorAll('a');
402                 anchors2.forEach(a => {
403                   if (a.textContent.includes(value)) nodeList.push(a);
404                 });
405                 break;
406             }
407             return Array.from(nodeList);
408           }
409         
410           function collectShadow(rootNodes, type, value, results) {
411             for (var i = 0; i < rootNodes.length; i++) {
412               var node = rootNodes[i];
413               if (node && node.shadowRoot) {
414                 // collect in this shadow root
415                 results.push(...collectInRoot(node.shadowRoot, type, value));
416                 // go deeper
417                 collectShadow(node.shadowRoot.querySelectorAll('*'), type, value, results);
418               }
419             }
420           }
421         
422           function doSearch() {
423             let found = [];
424             // 1) main document
425             found.push(...collectInRoot(document, type, value));
426             // 2) shadow
427             let all = document.querySelectorAll('*');
428             collectShadow(all, type, value, found);
429             return found;
430           }
431         
432           const startTime = performance.now();
433           while ((performance.now() - startTime) < maxWait) {
434             let result = doSearch();
435             if (result.length > 0) {
436               return result; // return array of elements
437             }
438             // poll
439             var now = performance.now();
440             while (performance.now() - now < pollInterval) {
441               // busy wait
442             }
443           }
444           return [];
445         }
446         return findShadowElements(arguments[0]);
447         """;
448
449   /**
450    * Finds all matching elements across the document and nested shadow roots.
451    * Waits up to the configured maximum wait time, polling every {@code DEFAULT_POLL_INTERVAL_MS}.
452    *
453    * @param driver The {@link SmartWebDriver} instance.
454    * @param by     The {@link By} locator to use for finding the elements.
455    * @return A list of {@link SmartWebElement} containing all matching elements, or an empty list if no elements
456    *       are found.
457    */
458   public static java.util.List<SmartWebElement> findElementsInShadowRoots(SmartWebDriver driver, By by) {
459      JavascriptExecutor js = (JavascriptExecutor) driver.getOriginal();
460
461      Map<String, Object> selector = parseBy(by);
462      selector = new java.util.HashMap<>(selector);
463      long wait = getUiConfig().waitDuration() * 1000L;
464      selector.put(MAX_WAIT, wait);
465      selector.put(POLL_INTERVAL, DEFAULT_POLL_INTERVAL_MS);
466
467      Object result = js.executeScript(FIND_SHADOW_ELEMENTS_JS, selector);
468      // The returned object should be a List<RemoteWebElement> if found
469      if (result instanceof java.util.List) {
470         return ((java.util.List<WebElement>) result).stream()
471               .map(webElement -> new SmartWebElement(webElement, driver.getOriginal())).toList();
472      }
473      // otherwise return empty
474      return java.util.Collections.emptyList();
475   }
476
477   /**
478    * Finds all matching elements within a given Shadow DOM root.
479    * Waits up to the configured maximum wait time, polling every {@code DEFAULT_POLL_INTERVAL_MS}.
480    *
481    * @param root The root {@link SmartWebElement} to start the search from.
482    * @param by   The {@link By} locator to use for finding the elements.
483    * @return A list of {@link SmartWebElement} containing all matching elements, or an empty list if no elements
484    *       are found.
485    */
486   public static java.util.List<SmartWebElement> findElementsInShadowRoots(SmartWebElement root, By by) {
487      if (root == null) {
488         return java.util.Collections.emptyList();
489      }
490      WebDriver driver = root.getDriver();
491      JavascriptExecutor js = (JavascriptExecutor) driver;
492
493      Map<String, Object> selector = parseBy(by);
494      selector = new java.util.HashMap<>(selector);
495      long wait = getUiConfig().waitDuration() * 1000L;
496      selector.put(MAX_WAIT, wait);
497      selector.put(POLL_INTERVAL, DEFAULT_POLL_INTERVAL_MS);
498
499      Object result = js.executeScript(FIND_SHADOW_ELEMENTS_FROM_ELEMENT_JS, root.getOriginal(), selector);
500      if (result instanceof java.util.List) {
501         return ((java.util.List<WebElement>) result).stream()
502               .map(webElement -> new SmartWebElement(webElement, driver)).toList();
503      }
504      return java.util.Collections.emptyList();
505   }
506
507   /**
508    * JavaScript function to find all matching elements starting from a given root element.
509    * The script searches within the specified root element and its shadow DOM,
510    * collecting all elements that match the given selector.
511    *
512    * <p>Supports standard Selenium locator types including ID, name, class, CSS selector,
513    * tag name, link text, and partial link text. XPath is not supported.
514    */
515   private static final String FIND_SHADOW_ELEMENTS_FROM_ELEMENT_JS = """
516         function findShadowElementsFromRoot(rootElem, params) {
517           const type = params.type;
518           const value = params.value;
519           const maxWait = params.maxWait || 10000;
520           const pollInterval = params.pollInterval || 500;
521         
522           function collectInRoot(root, type, value) {
523             let nodeList = [];
524             switch (type) {
525               case 'id':
526                 let elById = root.querySelector('#' + value);
527                 if (elById) nodeList.push(elById);
528                 break;
529               case 'name':
530                 nodeList = root.querySelectorAll('[name="' + value + '"]');
531                 break;
532               case 'className':
533                 var classes = value.trim().split(/\\s+/).join('.');
534                 nodeList = root.querySelectorAll('.' + classes);
535                 break;
536               case 'css':
537                 nodeList = root.querySelectorAll(value);
538                 break;
539               case 'tagName':
540                 nodeList = root.querySelectorAll(value);
541                 break;
542               case 'xpath':
543                 let xres = document.evaluate(value, root, null, XPathResult.ORDERED_NODE_SNAPSHOT_TYPE, null);
544                 for (let i = 0; i < xres.snapshotLength; i++) {
545                   nodeList.push(xres.snapshotItem(i));
546                 }
547                 break;
548               case 'linkText':
549                 let allAnchors = root.querySelectorAll('a');
550                 allAnchors.forEach(a => { if (a.textContent === value) nodeList.push(a); });
551                 break;
552               case 'partialLinkText':
553                 let anchors2 = root.querySelectorAll('a');
554                 anchors2.forEach(a => { if (a.textContent.includes(value)) nodeList.push(a); });
555                 break;
556             }
557             return Array.from(nodeList);
558           }
559         
560           function collectShadow(rootNodes, type, value, results) {
561             for (var i = 0; i < rootNodes.length; i++) {
562               var node = rootNodes[i];
563               if (node && node.shadowRoot) {
564                 results.push(...collectInRoot(node.shadowRoot, type, value));
565                 collectShadow(node.shadowRoot.querySelectorAll('*'), type, value, results);
566               }
567             }
568           }
569         
570           function doSearch() {
571             let found = [];
572             // Check rootElem's shadow root
573             if (rootElem.shadowRoot) {
574               found.push(...collectInRoot(rootElem.shadowRoot, type, value));
575               collectShadow(rootElem.shadowRoot.querySelectorAll('*'), type, value, found);
576             }
577             // Also treat rootElem as a normal DOM container
578             found.push(...collectInRoot(rootElem, type, value));
579             collectShadow(rootElem.querySelectorAll('*'), type, value, found);
580             return found;
581           }
582         
583           const startTime = performance.now();
584           while ((performance.now() - startTime) < maxWait) {
585             let result = doSearch();
586             if (result.length > 0) {
587               return result;
588             }
589             var now = performance.now();
590             while (performance.now() - now < pollInterval) {
591               // busy wait
592             }
593           }
594           return [];
595         }
596         return findShadowElementsFromRoot(arguments[0], arguments[1]);
597         """;
598
599   /**
600    * Checks whether there are elements with Shadow DOM in the current document.
601    *
602    * @param driver The {@link SmartWebDriver} instance.
603    * @return True if Shadow DOM elements are present, otherwise false.
604    */
605   public static boolean shadowRootElementsPresent(SmartWebDriver driver) {
606      JavascriptExecutor js = (JavascriptExecutor) driver.getOriginal();
607      String script =
608            "return Array.from(document.querySelectorAll('*')).some(el => el.shadowRoot);";
609      Object rawResult = js.executeScript(script);
610
611      if (rawResult instanceof Boolean result) {
612         return result;
613      }
614
615      return false;
616   }
617
618
619   /**
620    * Checks if there is at least one element that has a Shadow Root starting from a given WebElement.
621    *
622    * @param root The root {@link SmartWebElement} to check.
623    * @return True if the root element or any descendant has a Shadow Root, otherwise false.
624    */
625   public static boolean shadowRootElementsPresent(SmartWebElement root) {
626      if (root
627            == null) {
628         return false;
629      }
630      WebDriver driver = root.getDriver();
631      JavascriptExecutor js = (JavascriptExecutor) driver;
632
633      // Check if the root itself has a shadowRoot or any of its descendants
634      String script =
635            "if (arguments[0].shadowRoot) { "
636                  + "  return true; "
637                  + "} else { "
638                  + "  return Array.from(arguments[0].querySelectorAll('*')).some(el => el.shadowRoot);"
639                  + "}";
640
641      Object rawResult = js.executeScript(script, root.getOriginal());
642
643      if (rawResult instanceof Boolean result) {
644         return result;
645      }
646
647      return false;
648   }
649
650}
